intro: Diphasiastrum alpinum var. planiramulosum, commonly known as the alpine clubmoss, is a small evergreen fern-like plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe. It belongs to the family Lycopodiaceae and is characterized by its compact, creeping growth habit. The plant produces small, spiral-shaped leaves that are typically less than 1 cm in length. It thrives in acidic, well-drained soils and is often found in alpine and subalpine habitats. Due to its unique morphology and ecological significance, it is a valuable component of high-altitude ecosystems.
